wikipedia_page.main: David Sunley (born 6 February 1952) is an English former footballer who scored 44 goals in 324 appearances in the Football League playing for Sheffield Wednesday, Nottingham Forest, Hull City, Lincoln City and Stockport County. He played as a forward. He also played non-league football for Stafford Rangers.In 1973, he was a member of the Football Association's touring party under the management of Sir Alf Ramsey that visited Gibraltar.
